Sensing. Imaging. Accelerating.

Show More

About Us

The Center for Computational Imaging (CCI) at IIT Palakkad is an interdisciplinary center that is engaged in pushing the frontiers in all aspects of imaging - sensing and image acquistion, processing and visualization, and acceleration. The center aims to synergize research across several layers of the computational system to identify new opportunities for improvements.

The main objectives of the CCI are as follows:

  • Foster interdisciplinary research in all areas of computational imaging.
  • Construct pre-competitive prototypes and evaluate its practical viability.
  • Offer expert advice in the different areas of computational imaging
  • Disseminate knowledge in the centre to the community at large.

Facilities

Sensors

Supports design, simulation, fabrication and testing of novel sensing systems such as miniaturized ultrasonic, optical, physiological and radio frequency sensors.

Computational Software

Supports research, design and development of novel data acquisition systems, signal conditioning algorithms, image reconstruction and analysis algorithms and computer aided diagnostics and prognostics.

Hardware Acceleration

Supports exploration of hardware acceleration using field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), multi-core central processing units (CPUs) and graphical processing units (GPUs).
